utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: So what brings you in here today?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Hi, um so I've been very I've been, I haven't been feeling very well for the past four days. I've, I've been having chills. I am feeling short of breath and now my chest hurts.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Okay, I'm sorry. Um so how long, like can you just tell me what started first and when did this all kind of start?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: So, what started first? So, I would say the shortness of breath started first, um, and then I started having these chills and now it hurts like my chest hurts every time I try to take, try to take a deep breath in.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: And how long is this been going on for?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um, it's been going on for the past four days.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Four days, okay. Um, and do you have any kind of cough at all?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No cough.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Okay, so just shortness of breath. And can you describe your shortness of breath a little bit? Is it uh, are you having catching your breath, or would you say you're having trouble taking deep breaths? Or how would you describe it?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: It's mostly when I'm trying to take a deep breath in.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Okay, and uh, where would you say you're getting the chest pain?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um, it's mostly like centre of my chest, like, close to my, like I'd say it's like it feels like, it's not my like, it doesn't feel like it's inside. It feels more like it's pushing up on, on my chest wall.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Okay, I see. And is it related to you taking deep breaths at all?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yes, it's definitely when I take a deep breath in.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Okay, and what kind of pain is it? Is it like a sharp pain, stabbing pain, aching pain? How would you describe it?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um, it's a, it's, it's like a, I don't know. I guess it's a sharp pain when I try to take a deep breath in.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Okay, um, and does it get relieved with uh, when you when you expire?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Okay, and have you had any of these symptoms before in the past?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um, nothing like this.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Okay. Um, would you say like, your symptoms are constant, or do they kind of come and go?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um, they're pretty constant.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Okay. And are they getting worse at all?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, no it's not getting worse, it was just bad to start with and it's still bad.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Okay, and um, is there anything that you've tried that helps you with your breathing or relieves your chest pain? Anything that works for you?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um I guess sitting forward helps. Time now to take a super deep breath in.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Okay, and have you had any kind of fevers or chills?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, yeah, I've, I've had chills for sure. I felt hot. I haven't actually taken my temperature, so I'm not too sure about if I actually have a fever.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Okay, and when did you feel these chills?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: They've been going on for the past three days.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Okay. Uh, and do you have any kind of other symptoms, like runny nose, sore throat, anything like that?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh maybe like a slight runny nose, yeah.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Okay, and do you get short of breath when laying down at all?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um, I, no, not no, I wouldn't say so.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Okay, and do you have to wake up at night to catch your breath at all?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, nothing like that.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Okay, and do you have any kind of swelling in your legs, hands, anywhere?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Okay. Have you experienced any kind of um dizziness or fainting episodes?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Okay, do you get any kind of chest pain with any activities?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, not really. I guess it's, I get tired with the shortness of breath.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: And do you, um, find that your heart is racing at all?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh no, nothing like that.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Are you having any night sweats?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Um, have you had any sick contacts recently?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, I guess when I went to the grocery store the other day and there were people coughing around me.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Okay, and were they wearing masks or were you wearing a mask?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, everyone was wearing a mask.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Okay. Are you um, having any kind of changes in your bowel movements at all? Any constipation or diarrhea?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No, okay. Any changes in your appetite at all?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No. Any nausea or vomiting?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Okay. Any changes in your urinary pattern?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Okay, any changes in your weight recently? Have you lost any significant weight?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No, okay. Have you recently had a cold, like cold-like symptoms at all within the last few weeks?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um, yeah, I guess the runny nose. Um, I've had on and off for the past like 7 days.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Okay, now, it hasn't gone away?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, it's not that bothersome though. It's more the chills and the shortness of breath, and this chest pain now that is worrying me.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Okay, and do you have any past medical conditions or diagnoses?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um I was diagnosed with diabetes, um high blood pressure and high cholesterol.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Okay, and when were you diagnosed with diabetes?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I was diagnosed about 10 years ago.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Okay. Um, I'm sorry I forgot to ask you this specifically, have you experienced any kind of loss of your sense of taste or smell?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No, okay. Um do you take any medications for your medical conditions?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um, medications. So I take, so, for the diabetes I take insulin. For the high blood pressure I take ramipril. For the high cholesterol I take rosuvastatin.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Okay, and do you have any allergies to any medications at all?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Okay. Um, any recent surgeries or hospitalizations? Or any reason for why, if like, if you were immobilized at all?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um no, I don't think so.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Okay, any history of hospitalizations or surgeries at all?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, I had a cholecystectomy about, oh gosh, it's like, 12 years ago.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Okay, and were there any complications at all?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Okay. Um any family history of any lung conditions, heart conditions or cancers?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Okay. Um currently, do you work at all?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No I, no I'm retired.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Okay, and what's your living situation like?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I live with my husband, um in a condo.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Okay. Um and are you, is your husband well? Does he have any symptoms?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh yeah, he's, he's been okay.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Okay, that's good. Um, any kind of dust or mold, asbestos or any pets in your in your home?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, nothing like that.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Okay. Do you smoke at all?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um I used to, but not anymore.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Okay, and how long did you smoke for and how much would you smoke everyday?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, so I stopped about 20 years back. I smoked for about 25 years. I smoked about a pack a day.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: I see, um, and do you use any recreational drugs like marijuana?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um, I don't, no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Okay, and do you drink alcohol at all?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I, I'll have a glass of wine here and there.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Okay, and um yeah, so those were kind of, all the questions that I had today. Do you have any concerns or questions?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um, yeah like what, do you think I have COVID?

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Yeah so, right now it's definitely something that's on everyone's mind. Um some of these symptoms, um the shortness of breath and fever, definitely can be COVID, and that's something that we are going to test you with, and that's something we test everyone with. Um, but because you're having shortness of breath, uh, we do need to make sure nothing else is going on as well. Uh you can potentially have pneumonia that's not COVID, it can be any other virus or bacteria, so we will get some blood work done, we'll get your temperature and all your vitals taken as well, um and then get a chest x-ray as well.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Okay.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: And if it turns out at all that you have pneumonia, we'll just reassess and see if you need to stay in the hospital for longer, if you need any antibiotics within the hospital, or you can take them at home. So yeah, we'll do a full physical examination and do all those tests and then go from there.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Okay, that sounds great. Thank you.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: You're welcome. Um yeah, we'll be there with you shortly.

utterances.speaker: control
utterances.text: Add differential diagnosis
